page.title: 11GOVERNMENT IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: STOCKSBRIDGE HAS A TOWN COUNCIL WITH 8 ELECTED MEMBERS, 2 FOR EACH WARD. THERE IS ALSO A MAYOR. ITS LOCAL RATE IS FIXED BY THE TOWN COUNCIL AND THE CITY COUNCIL COLLECTS THIS ON THE FORMER'S BEHALF. SUBJECT TO CERTAIN FORMALITIES THE COUNCIL CAN SPEND THE PRODUCT OF THE RATE ON ANY PURPOSE WHICH IS, IN ITS OPINION, IN THE INTERESTS OF THE AREA. IT HAS THE POWERS TO PROVIDE, FOR EXAMPLE, COMMUNITY CENTRES, LAUNDERETTES, FACILITIES FOR ENTERTAINMENTS AND THE ARTS, BUS SHELTERS AND ALLOTMENTS. IT CAN MAKE GRANTS TO LOCAL ORGANISATIONS AND OPERATE A COMMUNITY PROGRAMME. STOCKSBRIDGE IS PART OF THE CITY COUNCIL AND IS REPRESENTED ON THE SOUTH YORKSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL.
